text: France "wouldn’t buy Texas beef for some reason, yet 76 percent of their energy comes from nuclear power."
"Most likely the primary control knob (for the earth’s temperature) is the ocean waters and this environment that we live in."
"Building a wall" on the U.S.-Mexico border "will take literally years."
Says Donald Trump is for a single-payer health care system.
"I deployed the Texas National Guard" to the Texas-Mexico border. "And the policy worked; apprehensions at the border declined 74 percent."
"Texas’ high school graduation rate went from 27th in the country in 2002, to second highest in the country in 2013."
"Texas now has the second-highest high school graduation rate in the country. And it has the highest graduation rate for African Americans and Hispanics."
"In the last seven years of my tenure, Texas created 1.5 million new jobs. As a matter of fact, without Texas, America would have lost 400,000 jobs."
"The entirety of North America -- Canada, the United States and Mexico -- there's more known reserves in those three countries than in Russia and Saudi Arabia."
"One out of five of our children live in a family that’s on food stamps."
On reauthorization of Export-Import Bank.
On in-state tuition for unauthorized immigrants.
"Thomas Paine wrote that ‘the duty of a patriot is to protect his country from his government.’"
"At this particular point in time, looking at the field, there’s only one individual that’s ever had the uniform of his country on—and that’s me."
"America produces more oil and gas than any other nation in the world."
"Obama has chosen to deny the vicious anti-Semitic motivation of the attack on a kosher Jewish grocery in Paris."
"When I came into office, our vaccination rate in Texas was 65 percent. When I left two weeks ago, it was 95 percent."
Texas has "the lowest crime rate in this state since 1968" because of changes in law regarding nonviolent drug offenders.
The U.S. unemployment rate has "been massaged, it’s been doctored."
Starting in December 2007, "1.4 million jobs were created in Texas. In that same period, the rest of the country lost 400,000 jobs."
"I belong to the AFL-CIO."
Congress is "on a five-week vacation."
The United States is at "historic record highs" of individuals being apprehended on the border from countries with terrorist ties such as "Pakistan or Afghanistan or Syria."
Says three Ukrainians recently captured on a West Texas ranch are among "individuals from countries that have strong terrorist ties being apprehended" near the state’s border with Mexico.
More than 3,000 homicides were committed by "illegal aliens" over the past six years.
Says the Obama administration never responded to his 2012 letter flagging the uptick in unaccompanied children crossing the U.S.-Mexico border.

Says of flood of non-Mexicans being apprehended at the border: "These are people that are coming from states like Syria that have substantial connections back to terrorist regimes and terrorist operations."
A record number of immigrants not from Mexico are "being apprehended at the border."
Since 2000, Texas has reduced "harmful pollutants in the air like nitrogen oxide by 62.5 percent, and ozone by 23 percent--a reduction that is 12 percent greater than the national average."
"If you rent a U-Haul to move your company, it costs twice as much to go from San Francisco to Austin than the other way around, because you can’t find enough trucks to flee the Golden State."
Texas added 6,600 miles of highway from 2001-2012, more than any other state.
"Ninety-five percent of all the wages in Texas are above minimum wage."
"Every engine manufacturer in the United States is now in the state of Texas."
"Every year, more than $40 million are leaving Missouri for the Lone Star State."
Says a growing number of extremely premature babies survive into healthy childhood.
"Abortion is the second-most conducted surgical procedure in this country."
Says Wendy Davis, "born into difficult circumstances," was the daughter of a single mother and a teenage mother herself.
Says the 2014-15 Texas budget increases spending by less than the rate of inflation and population growth.
Says New York has ‘bureaucrats telling you whether you can even drink a Big Gulp.’
Says Texas law requires state agencies to give preference to goods produced and grown in Texas.
Says 13 Texas universities "have announced or implemented a $10,000 degree."
Says Sam Houston opposed slavery and as governor said Texas should not leave the union over slavery.
"Over the last 10 years, Texas created 33 percent of the net new jobs nationwide."
Says he has "yet to get a response" from Barack Obama to his August 2010 letter making border security requests.
Says Obama called Medicaid "broken" four years ago.
"Only three in 10 Texas doctors are currently accepting new Medicaid patients."
Says Houston is "home to more doctors, more nurses, more researchers than any other place in the world."
Says Texas high school "graduation rates are at an all-time high—the third-highest in the nation—which represents a significant turnaround from just a few short years ago."
Says Texas public school funding grew three times the rate of enrollment from 2002 to 2012.
Says fewer than 30 percent of Texas college students graduate in four years and only 58 percent graduate within six years.
Says Barack Obama has added $16 trillion to the national debt.
Barack Obama has "provided guns to Mexican drug cartels."
Says Barack Obama has played nearly 100 rounds of golf as president.
Says you need a photo ID to purchase Sudafed in Texas.
Says that in fiscal year 2010, "nearly 80 percent of women served" in the Texas Women’s Health Program received services from a provider other than a Planned Parenthood clinic.
"A hundred percent of all the jobs lost during the recession have been reclaimed in Texas … while the nation is at about 36 percent."
Says there’s no proven instance where hydraulic fracking has polluted groundwater.
Says he signed legislation leading to 12 Texas abortion clinics being closed.
Says President Barack Obama "is a socialist."
"Santorum also voted for a teapot museum in North Carolina."
Says Rick Santorum voted for the Bridge to Nowhere.
On instances when abortions should be allowed.
Says Mitt Romney raised business taxes 20 percent in Massachusetts.
A study says Massachusetts has lost 18,000 jobs because residents were required to obtain health insurance under an act signed into law by Mitt Romney.
Says Texas did not bail out a loan program he oversaw as state agriculture commissioner.
Says the Obama administration catches and releases nonviolent illegal immigrants.
Says the paperback edition of Mitt Romney's book deleted line that Massachusetts' individual mandate "should be the model for the country"
Our "kids can’t openly celebrate Christmas or pray in school."
"A part-time Congress with half the pay would still make $38,000 a year more than the average American family."
"When you sanction the Iranian central bank, that will shut down (Iran's) economy."
"I have sent over $400 million to the border of Mexico in the form of Texas Ranger recon teams."
Says President Barack Obama thinks Americans are lazy.

Under energy efficiency legislation sponsored by U.S. Sen. Jeanne Shaheen, "federal bureaucrats could take over the local building code enforcement in your city if so-called ‘green mandates’ are not complied with quickly enough."
"We cut a record $15 billion from our state budget."
"We spend half a trillion dollars a year in tax preparation."
Says that under his tax plan, "no matter where you are in the stratosphere, you're going to be getting a tax cut."
Says Mitt Romney has flip-flopped on abortion rights.
Says that "we brought CHI Manufacturing, that had business in China, back to" Texas.
"In Texas, we created over 1 million new jobs while the rest of the nation lost over 2 million."
"Our president has labeled Americans as soft."
"We cut property taxes by one-third in the state of Texas while I’ve been governor."
"Romneycare was model for Obamacare."
"Romneycare has … killed 18,000 Massachusetts jobs."
Says he "came to the Republican Party sooner in age" than Ronald Reagan.
Coca-Cola’s CEO "said he finds it easier to do work in China than in the United States."
"My home state since June of 2009 created 40 percent of the new jobs in America."
Says the private sector in Texas created 1 million jobs over the past decade.
Says only four Texas legislators voted against a law giving in-state tuition rates to certain illegal immigrants.
Says that Romney touted the Massachusetts health plan for the nation in his hardcover book but then deleted it for the paperback edition.
Says he "got lobbied" by a woman with late-stage cancer about vaccinating Texas girls against a virus that can cause cervical cancer.
Says he never said he wanted to move Social Security "back to the states."
"The federal government has not engaged in (border security) at all."
Says Mitt Romney wrote that if Social Security was done "in the private sector, it would be called criminal."
Says he did not support the October 2008 legislation to rescue Wall Street firms.
"The first round of stimulus ... it created zero jobs."
Social Security is a "Ponzi scheme."
"When you look at what we have done over the last decade, we created 1 million jobs in the state of Texas. At the same time, (the rest of) America lost 2.5 million."
"Michael Dukakis created jobs three times faster" than Mitt Romney.
"I became a Republican sooner in my life than" Ronald Reagan did in his.
Says that when President Obama visited El Paso, he "pronounced that the border with Mexico and the United States was safer than it ever was in history."
Says President Barack Obama delivered $2 billion to Brazil to help with offshore drilling projects.
Says the national debt and President Barack Obama's "refusal to control spending led to our nation's credit rating being downgraded for the first time in history."
Says his hometown of Paint Creek, Texas, "doesn’t even have a ZIP code."
Says Texas gained 21,000 doctors due to tort reform.
Scientists are "questioning the original idea that man-made global warming is what is causing the climate to change. … (It is) more and more being put into question."
"In Texas, we teach both creationism and evolution in our public schools."
Says the government wants to require farm tractor drivers to hold commercial driver’s licenses even if they’re just crossing a single public road.
Says Texas has "the fourth-lowest debt per capita of any state in the nation, and we are the lowest of any of the big states."
Says legislative debate of airport pat-down procedures initiated federal changes in security procedures.
Says President Barack Obama’s overturning of the Mexico City Policy means federal tax dollars can be used "to fund abortion all over the world."
Says the 2012-13 state budget "leaves $6 billion in a rainy day fund."
"Since June 2009, about 48 percent of all the jobs created in America were in Texas."
Says the state’s budget shortfall is "not that much different" than it was in 2003.
Says a "rather extraordinary amount of non-classroom employees" were added by Texas school districts over the last decade.
Says the state’s rainy day fund is "our insurance policy against a major natural disaster."
Says neither President Barack Obama nor Mexico President Felipe Calderon "have been on the border to see what's happening to the citizens of Mexico, and for that matter the citizens of Texas."
Says the state share of Texas public education spending increased 82 percent over the past decade, reaching $20 billion in 2009.
Says some in Congress are trying "to create a separate government for those with a drop of Native Hawaiian blood."
"Texas added more jobs in 2010 than any other state."
Says there have been 50 million abortions since Roe v. Wade was decided.
Says the first word spoken from the moon was "Houston."
Says he’s the first Aggie governor of Texas.
Says the state's Medicaid waiver proposal "has languished in a file cabinet at the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services for more than two years."

"In 1981, Matagorda, Brazoria, and Galveston Counties all opted out of the Social Security program for their employees. Today, their program is very, very well-funded and there is no question about whether it’s going to be funded in" years to come.
Says federal health care overhaul will cost Texas state government "upwards of $30 billion over the next 10 years."
"Since the first of the year, 153 businesses at last count had moved out of California to Texas."
"The (federal) debt is growing by more than $4 billion a day."
"Social Security is indeed a Ponzi scheme."
"I had five of my citizens that were killed last week" because of border security problems.
Says Washington's reach extends to "even telling us what kind of light bulb we can use."
Says the federal government restricts "how much salt we can put on our food."
Says he has a track record of not raising taxes.
"More Texans have new jobs today than the entire population of Fort Worth."
"Houston suffered $1.7 billion in operating losses under Mayor Bill White."
"We've created more than 850,000 jobs, more than all the other states combined."
Says Bill White "didn't pay taxes while earning $133,600 annual salary as deputy secretary of energy."
Says Bill White is refusing to debate.
Says Bill White "profiteered in the aftermath of Hurricane Rita."
Because of violence spreading from Mexico, "you’ve got bullets hitting the city hall in El Paso. You’ve got bombs exploding in El Paso."
On debating.
"We have more kids take the SAT than any other state in the nation. I mean a high percentage of our kids take the SAT."
"We don't get a lot of calls from this White House… I have, frankly, never had a call from them."
Since 2000, "the Texas clean air program achieved a 22 percent reduction in ozone and a 46 percent decrease in NOx emissions."
Says an estimate that Texas will face an $18 billion budget gap is “a number that somebody just reached up in the air and grabbed."
"My opponent in November of 2008 sent a missive to the White House, to President Obama-elect, and said, 'Here's how you need to sell cap-and-trade to the American people.' "
"Bill White used D.C. connections from his job in the Clinton administration to form a company that did business in the Middle East and defaulted on a $60 million loan."
"The city of Houston now has more debt per capita than California."
“The percent of students who enter high school and eventually earn a diploma or equivalent, or who remain in pursuit of a diploma or equivalent, is 90 percent.”
"If you will go look up the definition of 'act of God,' we've used it in legal terms for a long time in this state."
Says in 2003 Texas cut "$10 billion out of the entire budget, yet we put $1.8 billion more into public education. We put $800 million more into health and human services."
Says Texas has been waiting for two years for the federal government to act on a proposal to allow the state to "create insurance opportunities for those that are uninsured today."
"We've got a 1,000 National Guard troop request that's been in front of this president for over a year and no response."
"Everyone in this country has access to health care."
Says he said last year there's "absolutely no reason" for Texas to secede.
"We had a press conference here that interestingly no one in the mainstream media covered."
"The number of uninsured people in Massachusetts is about the same as it was when the mandates were passed in 2006."
“This week liberal Bill White faced an ethics complaint about more than $83,000 he failed to report to the state Ethics Commission.”
My "border security efforts have led to a 60 percent decrease in border crime."
Texas is the "fastest growing state" with the "most Fortune 500 companies."
"Texas has installed more wind power than any other state, and all but four countries."

"Washington cannot hide from the fact that Congress hiked the national debt ceiling to $14.3 trillion. They cannot hide from the fact . . . that the budget that they’re going forward with has more than a $5 trillion in debt in it over the next five years."

"I vetoed more than $3 billion in spending. Lawmakers and I cut taxes for 40,000 small businesses. Now Texas is No. 1 in job creation. The nation’s five best housing markets are right here in Texas. We balanced five state budgets and we cut state spending."
Says the Texas Education Agency follows up to make sure undocumented immigrants paying in-state tuition at Texas colleges are applying for permanent residency.
"We have billions in surplus."
Says Sen. Kay Bailey Hutchison "took 154 private flights all funded by taxpayers" though "commercial flights were readily available at a fraction of the cost."
Says his executive order requiring young girls to be vaccinated against HPV wasn't mandatory.
"We cut property taxes by one-third."
U.S. Sen. Kay Bailey Hutchison “voted to continue Roe v. Wade.”
U.S. Sen. Kay Bailey Hutchison “has voted nine separate times to raise the national debt ceiling.”
"We lowered the business tax from 4 percent down to 1 percent."
"The Trans-Texas Corridor is dead."
Says Kay Bailey Hutchison voted for sanctuary cities.
"Sen. Hutchison abandoned Republicans and stood with Democrats to ensure health care legislation would pass quickly."
"More than 1,000 people ... move to Texas every day."
Says approximately 70 percent of jobs created in the United States in November 2007-2008 were in Texas.
